billEvents.eventText: referred to alcoholism and drug abuse
reported referred to ways and means

title: Requires development of educational materials for screening alcoholism and chemical dependency in women to health care providers
summary: Requires development of educational materials for screening alcoholism and chemical dependency in women to be made available to health care providers.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1078

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. JAFFEE, ORTIZ, SPANO, JEFFRIES, REILLY, PHEFFER,
         GIBSON, MILLMAN, MARKEY, GALEF, CASTRO -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of
         A.  BOYLAND,  COLTON, CROUCH, FINCH, JORDAN, McENENY, SALADINO -- read
         once and referred to the Committee on Alcoholism and Drug Abuse

       AN ACT requiring the office of alcoholism and substance  abuse  services
         to  develop  educational  materials regarding screening for alcoholism
         and chemical dependency in women to health care providers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.    As  causes,  symptoms,  and  effects  of alcoholism and
    2  substance abuse may manifest differently in women and men,  the  commis-
    3  sioner  of  the  office  of  alcoholism and substance abuse services, in
    4  consultation with the commissioner of the department  of  health,  shall
    5  provide  and publish, in electronic or other format, educational materi-
    6  als for health care providers, as defined in subdivision  6  of  section
    7  238 of the public health law, regarding screening, assessment, and diag-
    8  nosis  of  alcoholism and chemical dependency in women. Such educational
    9  materials may include, but shall not be limited to, information  regard-
   10  ing  symptoms  of addiction, causes of addiction, evidence based instru-
   11  ments health care providers may use in screening, screening  techniques,
   12  how  alcoholism and chemical dependency affects women's health, a refer-
   13  ral list for treatment, a list of educational websites  regarding  alco-
   14  holism  and  chemical dependency, and literature regarding treatment and
   15  recovery.  Such educational materials shall be made available to  health
   16  care  providers through the official website of the office of alcoholism
   17  and substance abuse services and by any other means  deemed  appropriate
   18  by  the  commissioner  of  the  office of alcoholism and substance abuse
   19  services.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03982-01-1
actClause: AN ACT requiring the office of alcoholism and substance abuse services to develop educational materials regarding screening for alcoholism and chemical dependency in women to health care providers
